intro: Phaeopappus paphlagonicus, commonly known as the Paphlagonian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically yellow or brown in color. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine, silky hairs. Phaeopappus paphlagonicus thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils.
